{{< include macros.qmd >}}

Joint likelihood of data set:
$\Lik \eqdef \p(\vY= \vy, \vD = \vd | \mX = \mx)$

Marginal likelihood contribution of observation $i$: 
$\Lik_i \eqdef \p(Y_i= y_i, D_i = d_i | \vX_i = \vx_i)$

*By the Independent Observations Assumption:*

$$
\ba
\Lik &= \prod_{i=1}^n \Lik_i
\ea
$$
Non-Informative Censoring Assumption: 
$T_i\ind C_i | \vX_i$

*Using Non-Informative Censoring Assumption:*

$$
\ba
\Lik_i &\propto [\pdf_T(y_i|\vx_i)]^{d_i} [\surv_T(y_i | \vx_i)]^{1-d_i}
\\
&= \surv_T(y_i|\vx_i) \cdot [\haz_T(y_i|\vx_i)]^{d_i}
\ea
$$

*Mathematical properties of survival and hazard functions:*

Density function:
$\pdf(t| \vx) \eqdef \p(T=t|\vX = \vx) = \haz(t| \vx) \cdot \Surv(t | \vx)$

Survival function:
$\surv(t | \vx) \eqdef \P(T > t|\vX = \vx) = \expf{-\cuhaz(t|\vx)}$

Cumulative hazard function:
$\cuhaz(t | \vx) \eqdef \int_{u=0}^t \haz(u|\vx)du$

Hazard function: $\haz(t |\vx) \eqdef \p(T=t|T\ge t,\vX = \vx)$

*Proportional Hazards Assumption:*

$$
\ba
\haz(t |\vx) &= \haz_0(t) \cdot \theta(\vx)
\\
\cuhaz(t |\vx) &= \cuhaz_0(t) \cdot \theta(\vx)
\ea
$$


*Logarithmic Link Function Assumption:*

Link function: $\logf{\theta(\vx)} = \diffloghaz(\vx)$

Inverse link function: $\theta(\vx) = \expf{\diffloghaz(\vx)}$

*Linear Predictor Component Functional Form Assumption:*

$$\diffloghaz(\vx) = \vx \cdot \vb \eqdef \beta_1 x_1 + \cdots + \beta_p x_p$$
